meanings.definition: To give a new form or structure to something.
meanings.sent1: She refashions her old clothes into trendy new outfits.
meanings.sent2: The designer refashions vintage dresses into modern pieces.
meanings.sent3: He refashions his room by rearranging the furniture in a creative way.
meanings.sent4: The artist refashions reality into dreamlike landscapes on canvas.
meanings.sent5: Refashioning the garden with colorful flowers brought new life to the backyard.

meanings.definition: To alter or remake something in a different style or form.
meanings.sent1: The tailor refashions the dress to fit the customer perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She refashions her hairstyle for a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The chef refashions the traditional recipe with a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: The architect refashions the building design to be more sustainable.
meanings.sent5: Refashioning the old bookshelf with a coat of paint made it look brand new.
